member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialStatisticsTools.GeographicallyWeightedRegression
member.summary: Performs Geographically Weighted Regression (GWR), a local form of linear regression used to model spatially varying relationships.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialStatisticsTools.GeographicallyWeightedRegression.#ctor(System.Object,System.Object,System.Object,System.Object,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The feature class containing the dependent and independent variables. (In, Required)
The numeric field containing the values that will be modeled. (In, Required)
A list of fields representing independent explanatory variables in the regression model. (In, Required)
The output feature class that will receive dependent variable estimates and residuals. (Out, Required)
Specifies whether the kernel is constructed as a fixed distance, or if it is allowed to vary in extent as a function of feature density. (In, Required)

Specifies how the extent of the kernel will be determined. When AICc or CV is selected, the tool will find the optimal distance or number of neighbors. Typically you will select either AICc or CV when you aren't sure what to use for the Distance or Number of neighbors parameter. Once the tool determines the optimal distance or number of neighbors, however, you would use the BANDWIDTH_PARAMETER option. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialStatisticsTools.GeographicallyWeightedRegression.in_features
member.summary: The feature class containing the dependent and independent variables. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialStatisticsTools.GeographicallyWeightedRegression.dependent_field
member.summary: The numeric field containing the values that will be modeled. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialStatisticsTools.GeographicallyWeightedRegression.explanatory_field
member.summary: A list of fields representing independent explanatory variables in the regression model. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialStatisticsTools.GeographicallyWeightedRegression.out_featureclass
member.summary: The output feature class that will receive dependent variable estimates and residuals. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialStatisticsTools.GeographicallyWeightedRegression.kernel_type
member.summary: Specifies whether the kernel is constructed as a fixed distance, or if it is allowed to vary in extent as a function of feature density. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialStatisticsTools.GeographicallyWeightedRegression.bandwidth_method
member.summary: Specifies how the extent of the kernel will be determined. When AICc or CV is selected, the tool will find the optimal distance or number of neighbors. Typically you will select either AICc or CV when you aren't sure what to use for the Distance or Number of neighbors parameter. Once the tool determines the optimal distance or number of neighbors, however, you would use the BANDWIDTH_PARAMETER option. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialStatisticsTools.GeographicallyWeightedRegression.distance
member.summary: The distance when the kernel_type is FIXED and bandwidth_method is BANDWIDTH_PARAMETER. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialStatisticsTools.GeographicallyWeightedRegression.number_of_neighbors
member.summary: The exact number of neighbors to include in the local bandwidth of the Gaussian kernel when kernel_type is ADAPTIVE and the bandwidth_method is BANDWIDTH_PARAMETER. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialStatisticsTools.GeographicallyWeightedRegression.weight_field
member.summary: The numeric field containing a spatial weighting for individual features. This weight field allows some features to be more important in the model calibration process than others. Primarily useful when the number of samples taken at different locations varies, values for the dependent and independent variables are averaged, and places with more samples are more reliable (should be weighted higher). If you have an average of 25 different samples for one location, but an average of only 2 samples for another location, you can use the number of samples as your weight field so that locations with more samples have a larger influence on model calibration than locations with few samples. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialStatisticsTools.GeographicallyWeightedRegression.coefficient_raster_workspace
member.summary: A full pathname to the workspace where the coefficient rasters will be created. When this workspace is provided, rasters are created for the intercept and every explanatory variable. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialStatisticsTools.GeographicallyWeightedRegression.cell_size
member.summary: The cell size (a number) or reference to the cell size (a pathname to a raster dataset) to use when creating the coefficient rasters. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialStatisticsTools.GeographicallyWeightedRegression.in_prediction_locations
member.summary: A feature class containing features representing locations where estimates should be computed. Each feature in this dataset should contain values for all of the explanatory variables specified; the dependent variable for these features will be estimated using the model calibrated for the input feature class data. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialStatisticsTools.GeographicallyWeightedRegression.prediction_explanatory_field
member.summary: A list of fields representing explanatory variables in the Prediction locations feature class. These field names should be provided in the same order (a one-to-one correspondence) as those listed for the input feature class Explanatory variables parameter. If no prediction explanatory variables are given, the output prediction feature class will only contain computed coefficient values for each prediction location. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialStatisticsTools.GeographicallyWeightedRegression.out_prediction_featureclass
member.summary: The output feature class to receive dependent variable estimates for each feature in the Prediction locations feature class. (Out, Optional)

member.summary: The directory of this tool's toolbox.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialStatisticsTools.GeographicallyWeightedRegression.ToolboxName
member.summary: The name of this tool's toolbox.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialStatisticsTools.GeographicallyWeightedRegression.Alias
member.summary: The alias for this tool's toolbox.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialStatisticsTools.GeographicallyWeightedRegression.ParameterInfo
member.summary: The parameters used by this tool. For internal use only.
